competitors.name: Microsoft
competitors.notes: File system security and access control built into Windows Server and Active Directory

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Data security and compliance solutions for enterprise environments

competitors.name: Symantec
competitors.notes: Enterprise security solutions including data loss prevention and access control

competitors.name: NetApp
competitors.notes: Storage security and data management solutions (Varonis founders were former NetApp employees)

competitors.name: EMC
competitors.notes: Storage and data security solutions for enterprise environments

competitors.name: Quest Software
competitors.notes: File server management and security tools

context: Varonis Systems was founded in 2005 by Yaki Faitelson and Ohad Korkus, former employees of NetVision and NetApp. By 2010, the company was establishing itself in the emerging data security governance market with its platform for managing unstructured data and protecting against insider threats. The market for specialized data governance was still nascent, with most competition coming from traditional security vendors and storage companies that included basic access control features. Varonis focused on metadata analysis and data access governance for file systems and unstructured data.
